docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 12-- Bowing to mounting pressure from farm interests the Govern  ment has decided to ask Washington to renegotiate the agreement under which Brazil is receiving as a three-year loan of 1,800,000 tons of wheat from United States...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 12-- Bowing to mounting pressure from farm interests the Govern ment has decided to ask Washington to renegotiate the agreement under which Brazil is receiving as a three-year loan of 1,800,000 tons of wheat from United States surplus stocks.
docs.abstract: Govt bows to domestic pressure, will ask US to let it cut imports it agreed to take for 3 yrs; domestic output seen up to 800,000 tons, '57

headline.main: BRAZIL SEEKS CUT IN U.S. GRAIN PACT; Rising Production Compels Bid to Reduce Imports of American Wheat

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 17--The General Assembly's Steering Committee will meet tomorrow afternoon to decide whether to recommend debate on a Syrian complaint that Turkey is threatening international peace.

headline.main: U.N. UNIT TO WEIGH SYRIA PLEA TODAY; Will Decide if Complaint on Turkey Should Be Debated

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 18--The farmers and ranchers on the broad Pampas of Argentina are unhappy again. Both groups, who provide the nation with 92 per cent  of its foreign exchange, feel they are again becoming the neglected step children of...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 18--The farmers and ranchers on the broad Pampas of Argentina are unhappy again. Both groups, who provide the nation with 92 per cent of its foreign exchange, feel they are again becoming the neglected step children of Government policy.
docs.abstract: '57-58 plantings down; farmers score Govt policies; charge neglect

headline.main: Government Policies Distress Argentina's Farmers, Ranchers; Directed Economy Scored FARMERS ASSAIL ARGENTINE POLICY

byline.original: By EDWARD A. MORROW Special to The New York Times
